markdown.markdown: * While the world sleeps * I wake * into the soft unfolding * of morning. *   * Between stanzas I’ve suddenly * forgotten (forgive me Szymborska) * is clasped * a single thread *   * of auburn. * It’s been months since * I last found you * rising *   * and falling * like a fawn yet nuzzled * by the cold breath * of winter *   * and demands * beside me * beneath familiar sheets. * My poems miss *   * your eyes, * my fingers * your scars, * my world *   * your gravity. * The strand still lingers * and dresses herself daily * in the same sunlight *   * and the same unturned pages * I still can't remember, * still waits for her sisters * to come again, loosen up *   * and curl themselves * around words, lines, and stories * that have yet to be read * by more than my eyes *   * alone.
